question: Navy Day is celebrated each year to commemorate which operation?
explanation:
Every year 4th December is celebrated by India as the Navy Day. This is done to commemorate Operation Trident. It was an offensive mission undertaken by Indian Navy on Pakistan’s Port of Karachi in 1971 during the Indo-Pakistan war.
The Indian Navy has planned to celebrate 2021 as ‘Swarnim Vijay Varsh’ to celebrate the 50 years of Operation Trident.
